page.title: 11Irthlingborough's Old Bridge
page.content: The old bridge is on the A6, it has been there for 7 centuries, it is made of sandstone and ironstone and there are red brick supports over the arches. There are 13 arch ways under the bridge. It is 80 metres long and 5 metres high. The bridge was originally built to carry pedestrians and horse drawn carts and was a single track with pedestrian refuges on both sides. As time went by, the bridge was widened to cope with increasing traffic. This first happened in 1754. They took the pedestrian refuges from the up-stream side and put supports under the water. By 1922,another attempt was made to do it again but the bridge could not take the weight and it started to show signs of crumbling. A new bridge would have to built.
